lead_paragraph: The Pentagon said Hafiz Saeed Khan, the leader of the Islamic State’s Afghanistan-Pakistan branch, was killed in an operation on July 26.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Says Strike Killed ISIS Leader in Afghanistan
headline.main: U.S. Strike Said to Kill ISIS Chief of Afghanistan-Pakistan Region

snippet: The Pentagon said Hafiz Saeed Khan, the leader of the Islamic State’s Afghanistan-Pakistan branch, was killed in an operation on July 26....
abstract: Pentagon reports Hafiz Saeed Khan, leader of Islamic State branch operating in Afghanistan and Pakistan, was killed in July during targeted American airstrike in Afghanistan.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
